intro: Paraboea sabahensis, commonly known as the Sabah paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Borneo. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
